title: Getting Started
description: Quick start guide to using Reduxy.ai for privacy-safe AI applications

body.raw:
# Getting Started

Welcome to Reduxy.ai! This guide will help you get started with our privacy gateway for LLMs in just a few minutes.

## What is Reduxy.ai?

Reduxy.ai is a privacy gateway that sits between your application and AI providers like OpenAI, Anthropic, and others. It automatically detects and masks sensitive information (PII) in your requests, routes them intelligently, and provides comprehensive audit trails for compliance.

## Quick Setup

### 1. Sign Up

{/* TODO: Add actual signup link when available */}
Visit [reduxy.ai](https://reduxy.ai) to create your account and get your API key.

### 2. Get Your API Key

After signing up, you'll receive an API key that you'll use to authenticate requests to the Reduxy gateway.

```bash
export REDUXY_API_KEY="your_api_key_here"
```

### 3. Update Your Code

Replace your OpenAI API base URL with Reduxy's gateway:

<CodeTabs examples={[
  {
    language: "curl",
    label: "cURL",
    code: `# Instead of api.openai.com
curl https://api.reduxy.ai/v1/chat/completions \\
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $REDUXY_API_KEY" \\
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \\
  -d '{
    "model": "gpt-4o",
    "messages": [{"role":"user","content":"Hello, how are you?"}]
  }'`
  },
  {
    language: "javascript",
    label: "JavaScript",
    code: `// Using OpenAI SDK
import OpenAI from 'openai';

const openai = new OpenAI({
  baseURL: 'https://api.reduxy.ai/v1',
  apiKey: process.env.REDUXY_API_KEY,
});

const completion = await openai.chat.completions.create({
  messages: [{ role: 'user', content: 'Hello!' }],
  model: 'gpt-4o',
});`
  },
  {
    language: "python",
    label: "Python",
    code: `# Using OpenAI Python library
import openai

openai.base_url = "https://api.reduxy.ai/v1"
openai.api_key = "your_reduxy_api_key"

response = openai.chat.completions.create(
    model="gpt-4o",
    messages=[{"role": "user", "content": "Hello!"}]
)`
  }
]} />

## Key Features

### Automatic PII Detection

Reduxy automatically detects and masks sensitive information including:

- **Email addresses**: `john@example.com` → `[EMAIL_1]`
- **Phone numbers**: `(555) 123-4567` → `[PHONE_1]`
- **Credit cards**: `4532 1234 5678 9012` → `[CREDIT_CARD_1]`
- **SSNs**: `123-45-6789` → `[SSN_1]`
- **IP addresses**: `192.168.1.100` → `[IP_1]`

### Request Headers

Reduxy adds special headers to track your requests:

- `X-Reduxy-Request-Id`: Unique identifier for each request
- `X-Reduxy-PII-Detected`: Number of PII entities detected
- `X-Reduxy-Processing-Time`: Time spent processing the request

## Example with PII

Here's what happens when you send a request containing PII:

```javascript
// Original request
const response = await fetch('https://api.reduxy.ai/v1/chat/completions', {
  method: 'POST',
  headers: {
    'Authorization': 'Bearer your_api_key',
    'Content-Type': 'application/json'
  },
  body: JSON.stringify({
    model: 'gpt-4o',
    messages: [{
      role: 'user', 
      content: 'My email is john.doe@company.com and my phone is (555) 123-4567'
    }]
  })
});

// Reduxy sends this to OpenAI instead:
// "My email is [EMAIL_1] and my phone is [PHONE_1]"
```

## Next Steps

- [Learn about PII detection concepts](/docs/concepts)
- [Explore the API reference](/docs/api)
- [Check out our SDKs](/docs/sdks)
- [Review security practices](/docs/security)

## Support

If you need help getting started:

- Check our [FAQ](/docs/faq)
- [Contact our support team](/contact)
- Join our [community Discord](#) {/* TODO: Add Discord link */}

---

**Ready to build privacy-first AI applications?** Continue with our [concepts guide](/docs/concepts) to learn more about how Reduxy works.

    'Content-Type': 'application/json'

});
